intro: Oxybaphus nyctagineus var. oblongifolius, commonly known as the nightshade nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Africa. It is an annual herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals.
